title: Buildbot interrupt can leave directory in an unbuildable state
body:
https://github.com/mozilla/rust/pull/7916 failed, and the interrupt managed to [catch git mid-operation on mac3](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-all-opt/builds/493/steps/configure/logs/stdio), leaving `src/llvm` such that [git doesn't want to run](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-mac-all-opt/builds/494/steps/configure/logs/stdio):

```
fatal: Unable to create '/Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/auto-mac-all-opt/build/.git/modules/src/llvm/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
Stopping at 'src/llvm'; script returned non-zero status.
```

(Presumably it's local to the mac3 builder.)

Update: looks like [linux3 has also been corrupted](http://buildbot.rust-lang.org/builders/auto-linux-all-opt/builds/518/steps/configure/logs/stdio):

```
Synchronizing submodule url for 'src/libuv'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'src/llvm'
configure: git: submodule update
Submodule 'src/libuv' () registered for path 'src/libuv'
Submodule 'src/llvm' () registered for path 'src/llvm'
fatal: Needed a single revision
Unable to find current revision in submodule path 'src/llvm'
configure: error: git
```

cc @graydon
